{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the branches of ECA (external carotid artery) that supply the nasal septum. According to the relevant documents, the sphenopalatine aery is mentioned as one of the terminal branches of the internal maxillary artery (IMA), which supplies the posterior part of the nasal septum. The anterior ethmoidal aery, facial aery, and superior labial aery are not mentioned as supplying the nasal septum. Therefore, it can be concluded that the sphenopalatine aery is the correct answer.", "answer_choice": B}
